file_content.text: I'm attempting to warn the Imperial fleet, but they may not intercept in time. You are the only chance to stop those ships.
Where is your ship hiding? Perhaps we shall destroy that, too.
We don't have much time. I recovered the computer core, but the Dread Masters are launching an attack on the Empire.
Blast it all.
That explains the signals we're picking up. Hyperdrives coming online not far from the fortress.
Get the gate codes off the computer. We're going into the fortress next.
Yes, of course. But please--do not let the Dread Masters' ships reach our worlds. What they would do... is unthinkable.
Hurry as you wish. But you will watch your planets burn.
One of your acolytes has gone mad. Your protection may be... wanting.
I am concentrating, I am trying to focus--what?
The watchtower. That's where we'll find the gate codes.
The troops are almost ready. We can secure a route to the fortress and protect your flank if you act as vanguard.
But we still need a way through the fortress gates. According to our recon data, they're built with highly dense materials: conventionally unbreakable.
Can we circumvent them? How are they controlled?
There's an outer watchtower with command of the gates. Its computers are built with ancient Sith and Rakata technologies--we scanned it from orbit.
I know the Dread Masters' designs--if you can seize the machine core, I can extract the codes needed to attack the fortress.
We'll have our troops start moving on the fortress itself. Bring us the machine core and and they'll strike at your command.
The threats have been dealt with, and the Dread Masters' technology neutralized.
Thank you for that.
You know, all my life, I aspired to heights of cruelty and passion.
But the Dread Masters... they went too far. We went too far. Passion without humanity is meaningless.
Shall I have Maiya salvage what you didn't destroy? I'm sure someone clever could make use of it.
Send a squad to gather what's left. Let's not let the Dread Masters' skills go to waste.
Agreed. Salvage the tech.
The Dread Masters build weapons for their sick satisfaction--not to win wars. There's nothing we can learn from them.
No. It's pointlessly cruel.
So be it.
Breathe of the spores. Feel your mind crackle in perfect magnetic radiance.
Our devices transform worlds so that the very ground produces fear. Primitive, biological instinct.
You only delay what must be.
This is the legacy of Dread Master Styrak. We feel the void he has left.
Every world will be lush with terror.
Every moment you stay, you come closer to understanding our vision.
This is base--whatever you've done, it's made the soldiers less susceptible to hallucinations.
We just picked up a power signature near your location. Be careful.
Where do they come from? Can you find it?
Are they not beautiful? My deadly creations.
A true weapon not only kills. It terrifies.
Accept them. Let them embrace you. Let them pierce you.
You believe my creations are vulnerable? Then go. Tear them apart.
Until next time.
Something dangerous is out there. We must destroy it before it destroys us.
Forgive the interruption, but we should discuss our plans for the Masters' fortress.
Not yet. I sense... pain, fear, and death nearby. Two sources of power outside the fortress walls, coming for us. I see no more.
Stay and shield us from the Dread Masters' power. If you lay out a strategy for the fortress, I'll intercept whatever's out there now.
I'll investigate. Get ready.
We are grateful. And we will be ready.
I never thought I'd meet a Sith Lord who'd turned his back on atrocity.
You're an enlightened Sith.
Are you mocking me? My hands are not clean. The things I've done... even you might cringe.
If that's the best you can do, no wonder you lost the task force.
That's awfully vague.
If it weren't for me, we'd all be bleeding from the ears! I'm all that stands between us and insanity!
Maybe you should concentrate on shielding our minds, my lord.
Can you find out what's out there before we're all slaughtered? We'll have the soldiers ready to attack soon.
Get it done. I'll make sure whatever's out there doesn't come any closer.
Once, I thought myself a monster. I played in rivers of blood and laughed as innocents quaked.
Yet when I touched the Dread Masters, I saw that my darkness was but a shadow of true depravity.
And you want us to trust you because, what... you've been redeemed?
Perhaps you'd rather return to the field to have your skull split?
Better than working for Sith dogs.
Don't fear the Dread Masters. Fear me.
Obey. You have no choice.
I hold your life in my hand. You will march because I demand it. You will fire on our enemies because the alternative is unthinkable. Am I understood?
Yes. I understand.
I admire your charm.
Whatever our differences, we all came to this world to stop the Dread Masters.
We both have the same goal.
We failed to do it alone--but if we work together, we have a chance. Should we survive... we go our separate ways.
You're serious? All right. Let me talk to my men.
How diplomatic. Perhaps it's for the best.
What you were saying to them....
It was true enough. In the Dread Masters, I saw a cancer. Now I recognize my own disease.
You think these allies will make you stronger? They will make you weak.
Abandon your cause. There is only despair here.
You have come far since last we met. You have potential.
Submit and know purpose.
We will taste your fear--or we will taste your rage.
These soldiers are doomed. Our nightmares suffuse them.
The things we will show you. The humiliations you will endure....
We have our new recruits. Suggest you return to camp.
Without more soldiers, we can't move on the enemy fortress. Find them.
Are you Lord Hargrev? Darth Marr asked me to find you.
What?
We're the remains of the task force, yes. You'll have to forgive us--Lord Hargrev is shielding our minds from the Masters, but it takes a toll.
Are there any ships still functioning? What's your current objective?
Give me a status report.
For now? Surviving.
What have the Dread Masters done to you, exactly?
You seem... troubled, Hargrev.
He's exhausted, that's all.
You don't need to worry about my mental competence. Maiya will fill you in--I need to concentrate.
This operation is now under my control. I am the Emperor's Wrath, my word is law and you will obey unto death.
I'm taking command.
You know who I am. Whoever you answered to before, now you serve me.
I'm in command now.
My oath is to Lord Hargrev.
And your feebleminded loyalty is appreciated, but we can make an exception in this case. Fill our new leader in.
I have experience with the Dread Masters and expertise that you need. If you want to survive, you'll take my advice.
I'm in command now.
This place is a mess. I'm not Sith and I'm not a soldier, but if you want to survive you follow my directions--understood?
Follow me if you want to live.
Lord Hargrev is in command here. But... as a representative of Darth Marr, you have our attention.
Just get on with it!
Between their mental dominance and their orbital weaponry, the Dread Masters managed to annihilate our ships. The survivors regrouped here.
Our hope was to make one final push to the Masters' fortress, but the Dread Guard has us trapped. We don't need firepower--we need manpower to break out.
Are there other survivors who can reinforce you? Give you the manpower you need?
The Republic. They came to Oricon, too--I can feel their soldiers out there. Trapped and afraid.
In that condition, they won't be hard to bring to our side. Especially not when we share an enemy.
We'll press them into service.
Darth Marr called you a sadist. But you sound like you're sympathizing with Republic troops.
Does their fear bother you?
My tastes are not at issue here! Those soldiers are.
This is your plan? Round up our bleeding enemies and hope they sign on?
That's your best idea?
They're desperate, they have no hope of rescue and we share a common enemy. You can mold them like clay.
It's murder out there. The Dread Guard have machine support--enough to cut our reconnaissance into pieces.
How long before we're overrun?
Hours, at best. Point taken.
I will shield you against the madness as well as I can. Bring us the soldiers we need to survive.
Three more gone, my lord. Two commandos took knives to one another--hallucination-induced psychosis, apparently--and Major Strix fled camp.
Stupid, stupid... knives? They can't even resist carving one another like roasts?!
I'm sorry. I know the things they saw... I can feel the Dread Masters, I can push them, but I can't stop it all. I'm so sorry, Maiya....
You have come far too late.
By Oricon's next sunrise, your worlds will burn.
Do not listen to the voices. Do not let them speak to you.
Stay and help as long as you wish. I'll have my men prepare a meal.
The madness is gone. I can feel it.
I can feel it!
The Dread Masters are dead--all of them.
The Dread Guard are falling back. We should target any surviving clusters.
Learn to celebrate, Maiya.
You were inside. What was it like? Were you... tempted at all? To live as a union of fear, without mortal inhibitions....
What I saw stays with me. Understand?
That's not your concern.
Of course.
You said it before. When you look into the face of darkness, there's nothing tempting about it.
It was a palace of horrors.
No, I suppose not.
They wanted to crush my spirit. To unmake me. But I would have been powerful, unchained by responsibility.
Tempted? Yes.
Find a planet somewhere and forget this war. You might come close enough.
We're also getting strategic updates from Darth Marr. Border sectors where he needs reinforcements.
And so the bloodshed must continue. At least the cancer in the Sith is gone; the Empire is a healthy body once again.
Your final instructions for Oricon?
The fortress and the palace are yours. Take the Dread Guard, if they surrender, and build whatever stronghold you like.
Seize any secrets you find.
How... unexpectedly generous. I assure you, my memory is quite keen.
Destroy what the Dread Masters created. Don't let the cancer come back.
Purge the evil from here.
My "perspective" is what haunts me. But I take your meaning.
My lord?
Give Darth Marr my best next time you see him.
Now then, Maiya. We have much work to do... and our friends have much more.
May the Force serve you well, Lord Wrath. We live and die in your master's name.
Give Darth Marr my best, Dark Lord. I wish you well in your dealings with the council.
Give Darth Marr my best, my friend. You walk a fine line, but I wish you well.
Give Darth Marr my best, hunter. I doubt you'll want for work any time soon.
Now come, Maiya. We have much work to do... and our friend has much more.
I hear them buzzing in my mind. They're waiting in the palace for you.
The fortress is open. Tear the Dread Masters apart.
Get to the fortress. Kill them for all of us.
Lord Wrath. It is done.
Dark Lord. It is done.
We are ready, my mysterious friend.
It is done, hunter.
The gates to the fortress are open. Squads of Republic and Imperial troops are holding a path.
And now that you've neutralized the Dread Masters' attack, I expect you'll go for the throat.
Stop them. Show the Empire that their depravity leads to weakness, not strength. Make sure no Sith is ever tempted to follow their path.
When I'm finished, no one will remember the Dread Masters.
I intend to do so.
I gather you're not coming to the fortress with me.
You're staying to meditate?
I'm not here to debate the Sith Code or to set an example. Battles are won through superior weapons and tactics.
This is war, not philosophy.
The ultimate weapon is the sharpened spirit of a Sith.
My acolytes and I will confront the enemy through the Force as you break their flesh. Perhaps we may even be useful.
Not enough.
You dared to stop our launch. For every Dread Guard killed, we will destroy one of your soldiers.
Unless you wish to bargain.
Tell us a secret. Tell us what you fear and we will spare your servants.
My soldiers have already cleared a path and your fortress stands open. Do what you want; it's too late to stop me.
Let them die. I need no one.
Die.
I saved as many as I could. I tried.
Soon. You will join us soon.
Stop it. You want to know something I'm afraid of? I'll tell you.
Fine--I'll tell you something.
Speak. Name your fear!
Darth Baras sought to use me as his weapon. I overcame him. But there are others, and I wonder if I can defy them all.
Becoming someone's tool.
I have been a slave, an apprentice, a collector of dark spirits. I have claimed power from nothing. But death itself still pursues me.
Death.
Every day I lie and manipulate. Every day I risk losing sight of my purpose and forgetting why I even do this.
Forgetting my identity.
One day, if I live long enough, I won't be fast or strong or sharp. I'll be a Grand Champion whose time is past.
My skills fading away.
There aren't a lot of people in this galaxy who are close to me. The thought of losing them... yes, it scares me.
Losing people I care for.
Let that thought suffuse you.
I make sacrifices, I endure misery, but I accomplish what I set out to do. Someday it may not be enough.
Failing to achieve my goals.
It will suffice.
Enough humiliations. You will join us soon.
Blood and failure will stain you. Then you will be ready.
Birth. Pain. Fear. Death.
Imagine the Citadel burning. Riots in Kaas City. The heads of Sith and slaves will roll as madness overwhelms all.
Our chemicals will mix with the pollutants of Nar Shaddaa. So many people, so afraid, so close together.
The Dread Masters have aborted the launch, and we've sent a warning about any ships that might have escaped.
We're ready to move on the fortress at your command.
The Empire cannot endure without the Emperor's guidance. When he returns, then we will be strong.
First we need our Emperor.
Of course. All glory to the Emperor.
The Dread Masters may be gone, but the future of the Sith is uncertain. There are many visions, and only one Order.
The Sith are still fragmented.
Then we trust the Dark Council to bring unity, of course.
The Empire has an opportunity--but reforms must be made, or we'll be undone by the same mistakes as always.
The Empire still must change.
Yes, well... we shall see if the Dark Council agrees.
The Dread Masters were never the worst of your problems. You want to survive the Republic, get your acts together.
Your Empire is still troubled.
I'm not a Darth or a council member. Your voice reaches more powerful ears than mine.
What about you? You had your moment, when you saw the darkness inside you... what will you do with that?
And are you still "redeemed"?
I don't intend to start a clinic for war orphans, if that's your concern.
As for the rest... I don't know. I have much to think about without a cloud of madness around me.
Think of these civil wars as a deck-clearing exercise. Those of us who survive are better off.
Conflict makes us stronger.
I agree, but that doesn't mean disease is to be cultured.
One of these days, the Empire will need the Dread Masters' power--no matter what Darth Marr and the others believe. Just remember who assisted you.
And as for you, Lord Hargrev... don't forget the lessons you've learned. The Empire needs Sith with perspective.
We will see it done.
You're mine, now. If I say "march", you'll march. If I say "fight", you'll fight. If you do anything else, you'll die. Got it?
Time is against us. The Dread Masters' forces must be stopped.
